verses.roman:
kva sapta-hāyano bālaḥ
kva mahādri-vidhāraṇam
tato no jāyate śaṅkā
vraja-nātha tavātmaje

synonyms: kva—where, in comparison; sapta-hāyanaḥ—seven years old; bālaḥ—this boy; kva—where; mahā-adri—of the great mountain; vidhāraṇam—the lifting; tataḥ—thus; naḥ—for us; jāyate—arises; śaṅkā—doubt; vraja-nātha—O master of Vraja; tava—your; ātmaje—concerning the son.
translation: On the one hand this boy is only seven years old, and on the other we see that He has lifted the great hill Govardhana. Therefore, O King of Vraja, a doubt about your son arises within us.
